resources.string:
When you set up a weekend getaway in the mountains with
 friends or family, all you have to do is pack your bags. If,
 until now, your mountain luggage consists of a few sweaters /
 sweatshirts, sneakers or boots and a raincoat, if you want to go
 into the category of professionals and learn to pack a perfectly 
 complete luggage in less than 30 minutes, we we come to your 
 aid!
 -->care products and cosmetics
 -->a raincoat
 -->a notebook / travel diary
 -->first aid kit
 -->mounting kit: LED flashlight, multifunctional knife
 -->car charger 
 -->portcard
 -->external battery
 -->spare batteries
 -->sundial wristwatch
 -->protein bars for an energy boost
 -->cap or hat
 -->bag or detachable pocket compartmentalized
 -->medicines: antiallergic, anti-inflammatory, food supplements
 -->electronic compass
 -->led bracelet / led strap
 -->headlight
 -->portable water bottle
 -->Dried fruits
 -->Sunglasses
 -->camera
 -->portable coffee / tea kit
 -->Map

To get rid of worries, we have prepared below a list of
 things and accessories that you should not miss from your 
 mountain backpack in winter:

-->thick socks
 -->heated scarf
 -->first layer, second layer
 -->hood for sports equipment
 -->hat with ears
 -->gloves (preferably made of softshell)
 -->frost cream, protective and moisturizing cream
 -->moisturizing lip balm
 -->goggles (for snow)
 -->winter jacket
 -->mountain boots (essential)

-->high protection sunscreen
 -->sunscreen for soothing affected skin
 -->polarized sunglasses
 -->cotton t-shirts and T-shirts
 -->mosquito repellent cream / spray
 -->a pair of sneakers that let your skin breathe
 -->cosmetics with SPF
 -->sport sandals (with flexible sole)

Here is what you need to take with you if you are going to go
 to the mountains with a tent:

-->sleeping bag
 -->beds
 -->sleeping pad
 -->rain foil for tent
 -->pillow
 -->a comfortable backpack
 -->flashlight + additional batteries
 -->thermos / liquid container
How was your experience in this location?
